title: download-url -O SUBDIR/ --archive  silently extracts in current (not SUB) dir if SUB not exists
body:
Took me a while to understand what is going on, since some times it was getting extracting under subdir (name was short -- easy to spot a typo), and some times into a current one (name was long, I had a typo in subdir name).

```shell
$> datalad create -c text2git testds; cd testds;
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/testds 
[INFO   ] Running procedure cfg_text2git                                                                                
[INFO   ] == Command start (output follows) ===== 
[INFO   ] == Command exit (modification check follows) ===== 
create(ok): /tmp/testds (dataset)

$> d=python-novice-inflammation; mkdir -p "$d"; datalad download-url -O "$d"typo --archive http://swcarpentry.github.io/python-novice-inflammation/data/python-novice-inflammation-data.zip
[INFO   ] Downloading 'http://swcarpentry.github.io/python-novice-inflammation/data/python-novice-inflammation-data.zip' into 'python-novice-inflammationtypo' 
http://swcarpentry.github.io/python-novice-inflammation/data/python-novice-inflammation-data.zip:   0%| | 0.00/22.6k [00                                                                                                                        download_url(ok): python-novice-inflammationtypo (file)
add(ok): python-novice-inflammationtypo (file)
save(ok): . (dataset)
[INFO   ] Adding content of the archive python-novice-inflammationtypo into annex <AnnexRepo path=/tmp/testds (<class 'datalad.support.annexrepo.AnnexRepo'>)> 
[INFO   ] Initiating special remote datalad-archives 
[INFO   ] Finished adding python-novice-inflammationtypo: Files processed: 15, +git: 15 
action summary:
  add (ok: 1)
  download_url (ok: 1)
  save (ok: 1)

$> ls  
data/  python-novice-inflammation/
```

but it is arguably not a bug per se but side-effect of a feature.  `-O` (as `--help` says) could be used to point to target file name to download to (and that is where the archive gets downloaded to first), and then it gets extracted from current directory:

```shell
$> git log --stat
commit 8a4c958836cc640a7cbff9b4ff2260447cde1776 (HEAD -> master)
Author: Yaroslav Halchenko <debian@onerussian.com>
Date:   Wed Oct 30 09:31:29 2019 -0400

    [DATALAD] Added content extracted from archive python-novice-inflammationtypo
    
    Files processed: 15
     +git: 15

 data/inflammation-01.csv       | 60 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
 data/inflammation-02.csv       | 60 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
 data/inflammation-03.csv       | 60 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
 data/inflammation-04.csv       | 60 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
 data/inflammation-05.csv       | 60 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
 data/inflammation-06.csv       | 60 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
 data/inflammation-07.csv       | 60 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
 data/inflammation-08.csv       | 60 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
 data/inflammation-09.csv       | 60 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
 data/inflammation-10.csv       | 60 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
 data/inflammation-11.csv       | 60 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
 data/inflammation-12.csv       | 60 ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
 data/small-01.csv              |  2 ++
 data/small-02.csv              |  2 ++
 data/small-03.csv              |  2 ++
 python-novice-inflammationtypo |  1 -
 16 files changed, 726 insertions(+), 1 deletion(-)

commit f747339165f8e30b0d22099e1e4552868d3e5b6a
Author: Yaroslav Halchenko <debian@onerussian.com>
Date:   Wed Oct 30 09:31:26 2019 -0400

    URLs:
      http://swcarpentry.github.io/python-novice-inflammation/data/python-novice-inflammation-data.zip

 python-novice-inflammationtypo | 1 +
 1 file changed, 1 insertion(+)
```

so I thought to suggest to throw a warning if `-O` specified together with `--archive` (which would imply extraction), but I feel that could be a reasonable use case as well.

So not sure if we could/should do anything, or may be someone has an idea?  If not -- we should close this one in a few days. Just wanted to share since was confused for a bit with behavior
